thread.section_title: Business News, Economy, Finance & ASX Market News
thread.title: Netflix soars to record high on second quarter results and 65.6m subscribers
thread.title_full: Netflix soars to record high on second quarter results and 65.6m subscribers

author: Paul Barbagallo and Lucas Shaw
title: Netflix soars to record high on second quarter results and 65.6m subscribers
text:
Netflix has built the first global internet TV channel. Photo: Bloomberg
Netflix, the top stock in the Standard & Poor's 500 this year, soared to a record high after reporting subscribers to its internet TV service increased to 65.6 million in the second quarter.
Netflix climbed 18 per cent to $US115.81 at the close in New York after the second-quarter results. That matched the gain recorded three months ago, when the company also reported better-than-expected new user data.
The subscriber results released on Wednesday by the Los Gatos, California-based company highlight its progress building the first global internet TV channel, fuelled by new shows such as "Daredevil" and "Sense8." At the same time, profit fell in the quarter as the company poured money into new programming, spending that will exceed $US6 billion next year.
Netflix's strongest growth was in international markets, where subscribers jumped 2.37 million to 23.3 million, the company said on its website. That beat the 1.94 million average of five analysts' estimates compiled by Bloomberg News. Domestic subscribers grew by 900,000 to 42.3 million, beating estimates of 636,000.
The company expanded to New Zealand and Australia in March, and is set to offer its service in Japan, Spain, Italy and Portugal this year. International subscribers now account for 31 per cent of Netflix's streaming revenue and the company said it is profitable in several of the foreign territories where it first offered service.
